# Question 3 - a


```{r}
# Load required library
library(ggplot2)

#load the data 

data(airquality)
# Create the scatterplot  - trend line
ggplot(airquality, aes(x = Wind, y = Solar.R)) +
  geom_point(color = "#3498db", size = 2, alpha = 0.7) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = TRUE, color = "darkred", linewidth = 1) +
  labs(title = "Relationship between the Wind Speed & Solar Radiation",
       subtitle = "New York Air Quality Data (May-September)",
       x = "Wind Speed (mph)",
       y = "Solar Radiation (lang)") +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 12) +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, face = "bold", size = 14),
        plot.subtitle = element_text(hjust = 0.5, color = "gray50"))
```

# Question 3 - b

```{r}
# Load the airquality dataset
data(airquality)


# Overlapping density plots (best for detailed comparison)
plot(density(airquality$Wind, na.rm = TRUE),
     main = "Distributions of Wind and Solar",
     xlab = "Value",
     col = "red",
     lwd = 2,
     xlim = c(0, 350))

lines(density(airquality$Solar.R, na.rm = TRUE),
      col = "darkgreen",
      lwd = 2)

legend("topright",
       legend = c("Wind (mph)", "Solar.R (lang)"),
       col = c("red", "darkgreen"),
       lwd = 2)
```

```{r}
# Load  library
library(reshape2)
library(ggplot2)

#dataset loading
data(airquality)


airquality_long_data_store <- melt(airquality, 
                        id.vars = c("Month", "Day"),
                        measure.vars = c("Ozone", "Solar.R", "Wind", "Temp"))




ggplot(airquality_long_data_store, aes(x = variable, y = value, fill = variable)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  labs(title = "Distribution Comparison of All Air Quality Variables",
       x = "Variable",
       y = "Value") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = "none")

```

```{r}
# Load the airquality dataset
data(airquality)

qqplot(airquality$Wind, airquality$Solar.R,
       main = "QQ Plot: Wind vs Solar Radiation",
       xlab = "Wind Speed (mph)",
       ylab = "Solar Radiation (lang)",
       pch = 19,
       col = "darkgreen")

# Add reference line (if distributions were identical)
abline(0, 1, col = "red", lwd = 2, lty = 2)

# Alternative: Add a line through the quartiles
qqline(airquality$Solar.R, distribution = function(p) quantile(airquality$Wind, p, na.rm = TRUE),
       col = "red", lwd = 2)
```
